summary: Established in 1992, the Ellerbe Marathon and Half Marathon is North Carolinaâ€™s oldest continuously held marathon, offering a rugged 'old school' experience in the rural landscape of Richmond County. The race features a challenging 13.1-mile loop on paved country roads characterized by relentless rolling hills that test the grit of every runner.
uniqueFeatures: Artisan Finisher Rewards: In a nod to local craftsmanship, every finisher receives a custom-made pottery wine cup alongside their traditional race medal.

Uncommercialized Community Spirit: The event proudly operates without corporate sponsors to maintain a grassroots, runner-first atmosphere that includes a home-cooked post-race meal of hot soup and quesadillas.
Historic Longevity: It holds the distinction of being the oldest marathon in North Carolina that has never missed a year, surviving through weather, leadership changes, and global health crises.
